characters/armon.html.title: Armon
characters/armon.html.description: Home | Player Character ListInfobox Spirit Speak ðŸŸ¥ Yes Armon is known for being a GravekeeperThey specialize in Spirits of the DeadDescended from a long line of gravekeepers for the amidonian royal family, Armon joined King Spiff's expedition as a spiritual advisor and researcher.

characters/carl.html.title: Carl
characters/carl.html.description: Home | Player Character ListInfobox Brute Strength ðŸŸ¥ Yes Carl is known for being a Guard CaptainThey specialize in TacticsFormer Mercenary now turned Guard Captain. An effective military leader and warrior. Has superhuman strength due to a pact with a blood demon. Hates Templars.

He then spent a couple millenia as different animals.

characters/nydid.html.title: Nydid
characters/nydid.html.description:
Home | Player Character ListInfobox Iron Gut ðŸŸ© No Nydid is known for being a Cook, Brewer, Mushroom FarmerThey specialize in Stews/Mushrooms/AlcoholFormer Spifftopian Templar, now runs a stew shop in a quest to explore the culinary arts
In search of a new beginning, Nydid arrived at the gates of Spifftopia, left in a state where power was shifting rapidly, and those without connections found themselves lost in the chaos. Penniless and weary from his long journey, Nydid sought refuge in the one place that still offered sanctuary to the downtrodden: the local church of Godking Spiff.Here, Nydid heard the sermons of the Church's priestess, preaching the divine rule of Godking Spiff, the god who, according to legend, had blessed the lands of Spifftopia with prosperity. Captivated by the teachings and desperate for purpose, Nydid found solace in the faith of the Godking.After the sermons, Nydid remained, offering his services to the church in exchange for food and shelter. What began as simple labor soon became an integral role in the daily operations of the church. He helped maintain the church grounds, assisted in organizing the donations, and tended to the flock of believers that streamed through the temple doors.
It was during this time that he met Davelore, a fellow refugee of sorts, who had also come seeking purpose within the walls of the church. Together, the two worked tirelessly to support the church as its influence spread across Spifftopia. Their loyalty did not go unnoticed.As the Church grew in power, more people flocked to its cause, and soon, the voice of Godking Spiff echoed far beyond the city. The Church became a central power in Spifftopiaâ€™s political landscape, often mediating disputes and consolidating its influence over the common folk and nobles alike.
Nydid and Daveloreâ€™s dedication was rewarded when they were both inducted into the Templar Order, the militant arm of the Church. Clad in the sacred armor of the templars and wielding weapons blessed in the name of Godking Spiff, Nydid swore an oath to protect the faith and enforce the Churchâ€™s laws. His duty was clear: to defend the Church from its enemies, both internal and external.
While Davelore quickly ascended the ranks, eventually becoming Templar Grandmaster, Nydid took a more humble path. Though a skilled fighter, he found a deeper calling in ensuring that the Churchâ€™s ranks were well-fed and supplied during the times of famine. His contributions were not on the battlefield but in the kitchens, where he transformed meager rations into meals that kept the Church's forces strong.However, as the years passed, Nydid began to notice cracks in the foundation of the Church he had sworn to serve. Corruption, greed, and a thirst for political power seemed to infect the upper ranks of the clergy. Once a humble institution dedicated to the worship of Godking Spiff, the Church had become a political machine, prioritizing its own gain over the well-being of the people it claimed to protect.Nydidâ€™s disillusionment grew as he witnessed the suffering of the common folk, ignored by a Church more focused on expanding its wealth and influence. He spoke out, urging the Church leaders to return to their true purpose: serving the people in the name of Godking Spiff. But instead of listening, they silenced him.Branded a traitor to the Church, Nydid was stripped of his rank and exiled to a distant island, far from Spifftopia. Though the exile was presented as an act of mercy, it was clear to Nydid that it was meant to be his end. Banished from the only life he had known, he was left with nothing but his skills and his faithâ€”though even that was shaken.The island was a harsh and desolate place, inhabited only by a few fellow exiles. Despite the isolation, Nydid found a sense of peace in the simplicity of his new life. He no longer had to navigate the treacherous politics of Spifftopia, and for the first time in years, he was free to live without fear of betrayal.Nydid did not take on any formal roles in the small exile community. Instead, he helped wherever he could, offering his strength and skills as needed. Often, he would join expeditions into the wild, venturing into untamed lands in search of resources.Mining for the town became one of his primary contributions. He spent hours in the dark caverns beneath the island, searching for precious minerals and materials that could help the community survive. Though the work was grueling, it gave him a sense of purpose and helped him distance himself from the political scheming of his past.But Nydidâ€™s greatest contribution came not from the forge or the fields, but from the kitchen. Drawing on the skills he had honed during the Spifftopian Famines, Nydid began cooking for the community. What started as simple meals soon became a source of pride for him.He set up a small stew shop in the inner ward, where he provided nourishing meals to the townsfolk. As he stirred the bubbling pots, Nydid found a new sense of purposeâ€”not in battle or in service to a corrupt institution, but in the simple act of feeding those in need.

misc/am-i-missing-a-feature.html.title: Am I missing a feature
misc/am-i-missing-a-feature.html.description:
Information is sourced from a Google Sheet
I can pull this data with a python script It will remove frontmatter elements that are no longer in the google sheet and update the ones that have changed
It can create a new file if a row has been added
It will also copy the Character Icon template to prevent image template loading issues I can update the file template with a python script, meaning any data that is after the template can be saved while still modifying the template for all the Character files
Safety Features: Backup Creation: Before modifying or deleting frontmatter or templates, it would be good practice to create a backup of each markdown file. This way, if an error occurs during the process (or in case of unintended changes), you can easily roll back. Implementation: Create a Backups folder where a timestamped copy of each file is saved before making changes. Validation Before Overwriting: When syncing from Google Sheets, you should validate that the data is correct before overwriting the frontmatter in the markdown files. This could include checks for missing fields, invalid data types, or malformed entries. Implementation: Add a validation step to the Python script that checks for inconsistencies between the Google Sheet data and the expected format. Dry Run Mode: Implement a "dry run" feature in your Python script that will show what changes will be made without actually executing them. This allows you to verify the proposed changes before applying them to the files. Transaction-Like Operation: Ensure that your script performs changes atomically, so if thereâ€™s an error partway through an operation (e.g., a failure to copy an image or a permission issue), it rolls back to the original state. Log All Changes: Keep a log of all changes made by your Python script. This could be useful for debugging and tracking what was updated, deleted, or created. Additional Functionality Suggestions: Template Versioning: Implement a version control for your templates. This way, if a template is updated, your script can detect which version is being used in each file and update accordingly, without overwriting custom changes users may have made within individual notes. Automatic Image Resizing/Optimization: When copying the Character Icon template, ensure that the images are optimized for web display (e.g., smaller file size for faster loading). If the original image is too large, consider automatically resizing or compressing it. Sync Status Dashboard: Create a simple dashboard or log output within Obsidian that tracks the sync status for each character file. This can show whether each file is up to date with the latest Google Sheets data, needs updating, or encountered issues during syncing. Conflict Handling: If two users are working on the same file (e.g., modifying the Google Sheet and the Obsidian note simultaneously), your script should have conflict detection and resolution mechanisms (e.g., alerting you to manually review changes).

misc/project-kanban.html.title: Project Kanban
misc/project-kanban.html.description:
Ideas4Spifftopian Calendar ConverterPython - Safety Features Backups: Create a backup of markdown files before modifying them. Validation: Check Google Sheets data for inconsistencies before overwriting. Dry Run Mode: Preview changes before applying them. Atomic Changes: Ensure changes are rolled back if errors occur.
Logging: Keep a log of all changes made. Templates - Functionality Improvements
Template Versioning: Track template versions and update accordingly. Test HelloNydid is known for being a Cook, Brewer, Mushroom FarmerThey specialize in Stews/Mushrooms/Alcohol
Occupation: Cook, Brewer, Mushroom FarmerSpecialization: Stews/Mushrooms/AlcoholAbilities: Iron GutPermadeath: ðŸŸ© NoPermadeath: ðŸŸ© Noâ” undefinedThe building holds a significant place in the lore: -This Stew Shop is known for its purpose of Producing Stew, producing StewYesundefinedNo extra data found.
In search of a new beginning, Nydid arrived at the gates of Spifftopia, left in a state where power was shifting rapidly, and those without connections found themselves lost in the chaos. Penniless and weary from his long journey, Nydid sought refuge in the one place that still offered sanctuary to the downtrodden: the local church of Godking Spiff.Here, Nydid heard the sermons of the Church's priestess, preaching the divine rule of Godking Spiff, the god who, according to legend, had blessed the lands of Spifftopia with prosperity. Captivated by the teachings and desperate for purpose, Nydid found solace in the faith of the Godking.After the sermons, Nydid remained, offering his services to the church in exchange for food and shelter. What began as simple labor soon became an integral role in the daily operations of the church. He helped maintain the church grounds, assisted in organizing the donations, and tended to the flock of believers that streamed through the temple doors.
It was during this time that he met Davelore, a fellow refugee of sorts, who had also come seeking purpose within the walls of the church. Together, the two worked tirelessly to support the church as its influence spread across Spifftopia. Their loyalty did not go unnoticed.As the Church grew in power, more people flocked to its cause, and soon, the voice of Godking Spiff echoed far beyond the city. The Church became a central power in Spifftopiaâ€™s political landscape, often mediating disputes and consolidating its influence over the common folk and nobles alike.
Nydid and Daveloreâ€™s dedication was rewarded when they were both inducted into the Templar Order, the militant arm of the Church. Clad in the sacred armor of the templars and wielding weapons blessed in the name of Godking Spiff, Nydid swore an oath to protect the faith and enforce the Churchâ€™s laws. His duty was clear: to defend the Church from its enemies, both internal and external.
While Davelore quickly ascended the ranks, eventually becoming Templar Grandmaster, Nydid took a more humble path. Though a skilled fighter, he found a deeper calling in ensuring that the Churchâ€™s ranks were well-fed and supplied during the times of famine. His contributions were not on the battlefield but in the kitchens, where he transformed meager rations into meals that kept the Church's forces strong.However, as the years passed, Nydid began to notice cracks in the foundation of the Church he had sworn to serve. Corruption, greed, and a thirst for political power seemed to infect the upper ranks of the clergy. Once a humble institution dedicated to the worship of Godking Spiff, the Church had become a political machine, prioritizing its own gain over the well-being of the people it claimed to protect.Nydidâ€™s disillusionment grew as he witnessed the suffering of the common folk, ignored by a Church more focused on expanding its wealth and influence. He spoke out, urging the Church leaders to return to their true purpose: serving the people in the name of Godking Spiff. But instead of listening, they silenced him.Branded a traitor to the Church, Nydid was stripped of his rank and exiled to a distant island, far from Spifftopia. Though the exile was presented as an act of mercy, it was clear to Nydid that it was meant to be his end. Banished from the only life he had known, he was left with nothing but his skills and his faithâ€”though even that was shaken.The island was a harsh and desolate place, inhabited only by a few fellow exiles. Despite the isolation, Nydid found a sense of peace in the simplicity of his new life. He no longer had to navigate the treacherous politics of Spifftopia, and for the first time in years, he was free to live without fear of betrayal.Nydid did not take on any formal roles in the small exile community. Instead, he helped wherever he could, offering his strength and skills as needed. Often, he would join expeditions into the wild, venturing into untamed lands in search of resources.Mining for the town became one of his primary contributions. He spent hours in the dark caverns beneath the island, searching for precious minerals and materials that could help the community survive. Though the work was grueling, it gave him a sense of purpose and helped him distance himself from the political scheming of his past.But Nydidâ€™s greatest contribution came not from the forge or the fields, but from the kitchen. Drawing on the skills he had honed during the Spifftopian Famines, Nydid began cooking for the community. What started as simple meals soon became a source of pride for him.He set up a small stew shop in the inner ward, where he provided nourishing meals to the townsfolk. As he stirred the bubbling pots, Nydid found a new sense of purposeâ€”not in battle or in service to a corrupt institution, but in the simple act of feeding those in need.Title Hi Hello Welcome Bye o7 Infobox Heading Test hidden info

misc/tutorial-note.html.title: Tutorial Note
misc/tutorial-note.html.description:
Headings Create Headings using #: # Heading 1 ## Heading 2 ### Heading 3 Text Formating Bold: **text** Italics: *text* Strikethrough: ~~text~~ Bold and Italic: **Bold and _Italic_** Links Internal: [[Note Name]] External: [Link](URL) Image: ![Alt Text](URL) Lists Unordered: - Item Ordered: 1. Item Tasks: - [ ] Incomplete - [x] Complete Icons You can add icons by using the :icon_name: shortcode. - :Vanilla_absorption:
- :Vanilla_minecraft_campfire: Centered - Using the #t-centered tag Wide - Using the #t-wide tag Top Aligned - Using the #t-top tag Middle Aligned Bottom Aligned

npcs/alenfar.html.title: Alenfar
npcs/alenfar.html.description: Home | NPC ListInfobox Unknown Deceased Alenfar is an NPC aligned with the Amidonian TemplarsIn short, they are a Templar LeaderHigh Templar on the Dark Isles, Alenfar oversees a wide ranging extraction operation on the Dark Isles, which has included the import of many convict labourers, including many colonists. This has made him unpopular with the Spifftopians, although his relationship with our town remains on generally amicable terms.

npcs/gerilo.html.description: Home | NPC ListInfobox Unknown Deceased Gerilo is an NPC aligned with the EscapeesIn short, they are a Writer Gerilio recorded the events leading up to the destruction of voyager's end, and the process that led to Marcus establishing Falandar's Cult

npcs/gutankrt.html.title: Gutankrt
npcs/gutankrt.html.description: Home | NPC ListInfobox Unknown ðŸŸ© Alive Gutankrt is an NPC aligned with the Amidonian InquisitionIn short, they are a Grand InquisitorOne of two Grand inqusitors on the Dark Isles, Gutankrt is supernaturally strong. Generally considered offputting by the colonists, they nevertheless appear to have assisted the colony by using a considerable number of lapis blocks to seal the entrance to falandar proper. Resides in the inquisition's snowy outpost, where they delight in torture and stabbing visitors with a weird stick

npcs/helen.html.description: Home | NPC ListInfobox Unknown Unknown Helen is an NPC aligned with the Castle StaffIn short, they are a MaidSubject to "Amidonian Conditioning", Helen has effectively had her free will stripped and will follow orders unquestioningly. She was bought from the Merchants by Carl, and was subsequently gifted to the Governor. How she arrived on the Isles as a slave is unknown.

npcs/seastik.html.title: Seastik
npcs/seastik.html.description: Home | NPC ListInfobox Unknown ðŸŸ© Alive Seastik is an NPC aligned with the GuardsIn short, they are a DrunkardEx pirate captain who has racked up massive debts to unreputable lenders. He is best known for his drinking problems, his hatred of anyone who gets inbetween him and destroying his liver further, taking the first set of player characters to the island, and drinking. Dislikes authority, especially the Governor, who evicted him from his original shack

Is generally more sane than his comrade, although he acts more as a subordinate to Gutankrt than an equal, at least in public

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. Multiple values will be tried in order until one succeeds. Multiple values will not insert this feature multiple times.

info_includePath.description: The path on the server from which this feature can be loaded

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the closer connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make the graph appear more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. Multiple values will be tried in order until one succeeds. Multiple values will not insert this feature multiple times.

info_includePath.description: The path on the server from which this feature can be loaded

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded
